title: A Pliny of the New World
cleaned_text: Pliny's Naturalis Historia, a monumental work from the first century that purports to contain all knowledge about nature. In the 1570s, the king of Spain commissioned Hernández to create "a Pliny of all Native American knowledge about nature and medicine in a single encyclopedic work. Hernández was never able to complete the monumental task: not only did he find Native American knowledge too vast and confounding to be synthesized in a single descriptive expedition was deterred Elder. Historia Natural. Translated by Francisco Hernández. Sixteenth century. Biblioteca Nacional de España, Madrid, Mss/2868, XXI, [fols. 47v-48r](http://bdh-rd.bne.es/viewer.vm?id=0000023053&page=51). Courtesy of the collections of the Biblioteca Nacional de España. Further Reading - Castaño Ríos, Victoria.
